articles.headline: Iceland’s Prime Minister Steps Down Amid Panama Papers Scandal
articles.snippet: The departure of Sigmundur David Gunnlaugsson is the most prominent fallout from the leaked papers. Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain is also battling revelations that involve his family.
articles.abstract: The departure of Sigmundur David Gunnlaugsson is the most prominent fallout from the leaked papers. Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain is also battling revelations that involve his family.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The revelation of vast wealth hidden by politicians and powerful figures across the globe set off criminal investigations on at least two continents on Tuesday, forced leaders from Europe to Asia to beat back calls for their removal and claimed its first political casualty — pressuring the prime minister of Iceland to step down.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger, Stephen Castle and Rick Gladstone

articles.headline: Pfizer and Allergan Are Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten
articles.snippet: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.
articles.abstract: The broader reach of regulations, intended to keep companies from cutting deals to move income overseas, appears to have caught many by surprise.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pfizer plans to abandon its $152 billion merger with Allergan — the largest deal yet aimed at helping an American company shed its United States corporate citizenship for a lower tax bill — just days after the Obama administration introduced new tax rules, a person briefed on the matter said late Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Leslie Picker

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Rise Shows Religion Is Losing Its Political Power
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s campaign suggests that an alignment of interests on the right, entwining religious fervor with free market economics, is fraying.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s campaign suggests that an alignment of interests on the right, entwining religious fervor with free market economics, is fraying.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump, no doubt, is the most confounding candidate produced by the American political system in decades. He offers enormous tax cuts, as any bona fide Republican candidate must. But he also wants to leave Social Security “as it is.”

articles.headline: As an Investor, Osama bin Laden Was Bullish on Gold
articles.snippet: An order to buy gold bars and coins with ransom money was in a letter that was part of the trove seized by Navy SEALs at Bin Laden’s hide-out in Pakistan.
articles.abstract: An order to buy gold bars and coins with ransom money was in a letter that was part of the trove seized by Navy SEALs at Bin Laden’s hide-out in Pakistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Osama bin Laden, gold bug?

articles.headline: Wisconsin Goes to Cruz, Raising Chance of Fight at Convention
articles.snippet: Senator Ted Cruz’s victory, capping a difficult week for Donald J. Trump, makes it more likely that the race will not be settled until July.
articles.abstract: Senator Ted Cruz’s victory, capping a difficult week for Donald J. Trump, makes it more likely that the race will not be settled until July.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Ted Cruz soundly defeated Donald J. Trump in the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, breathing new life into efforts to halt Mr. Trump’s divisive presidential candidacy and dealing a blow to his chances of clinching the Republican nomination before the party’s summer convention.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders Wins Wisconsin Democratic Primary, Adding to Momentum
articles.snippet: Mr. Sanders cut into Hillary Clinton’s delegate lead as his message of economic populism continued to resonate, but he still faces an uphill fight for the nomination.
articles.abstract: Mr. Sanders cut into Hillary Clinton’s delegate lead as his message of economic populism continued to resonate, but he still faces an uphill fight for the nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Bernie Sanders defeated Hillary Clinton in the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, his sixth straight victory in the Democratic nominating contest and the latest in a string of setbacks for Mrs. Clinton as she seeks to put an end to a prolonged race against an unexpectedly deft and well-funded competitor.

articles.headline: Robert Iger’s Success at Disney Makes Him a Tough Act to Follow
articles.snippet: As the conglomerate looks for a new leader, it’s having difficulty finding someone, even the heir apparent, who appears able to measure up.
articles.abstract: As the conglomerate looks for a new leader, it’s having difficulty finding someone, even the heir apparent, who appears able to measure up.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — On Monday night, as a stunned Hollywood scrambled to understand why Disney’s heir apparent, Thomas O. Staggs, had abruptly decided to step down, the company held a lavish premiere for its “Jungle Book” movie.

articles.headline: A Wall Street Family’s Charmed Life Is Thrown Into Turmoil
articles.snippet: Andrew Caspersen came from a world of privilege, blown apart by allegations that he conducted a fraudulent investment scheme.
articles.abstract: Andrew Caspersen came from a world of privilege, blown apart by allegations that he conducted a fraudulent investment scheme.
articles.lead_paragraph: Andrew Caspersen violated a circle of trust that included colleagues, a Princeton classmate and even his wealthy family when he raised tens of millions of dollars for what authorities have called a fraudulent investment scheme that has rattled Wall Street.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Donald Trump Settled a Real Estate Lawsuit, and a Criminal Case Was Closed
articles.snippet: In 2011, Mr. Trump and his co-defendants settled a suit involving one of his buildings amid a storm that threatened to cast a harsh light on how he did business.
articles.abstract: In 2011, Mr. Trump and his co-defendants settled a suit involving one of his buildings amid a storm that threatened to cast a harsh light on how he did business.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Donald J. Trump, it is a long-held legal strategy, if not a point of pride, to avoid knuckling under to plaintiffs in court.

articles.headline: ‘Customers First’ to Become the Law in Retirement Investing
articles.snippet: The Labor Department, after years of battling Wall Street and the insurance industry, will require financial advisers and brokers to act in their clients’ best interests.
articles.abstract: The Labor Department, after years of battling Wall Street and the insurance industry, will require financial advisers and brokers to act in their clients’ best interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: The rules governing how financial professionals handle the trillions of dollars they invest on behalf of Americans saving for retirement are about to get a lot tougher.

articles.headline: Pfizer Faces Limited Options After Its Dead Deal With Allergan
articles.snippet: The company has been growing steadily, but investors are certain to start agitating again to complete a bold move in order to push growth higher.
articles.abstract: The company has been growing steadily, but investors are certain to start agitating again to complete a bold move in order to push growth higher.
articles.byline: By Katie Thomas and Chad Bray
